rComments: Shaowei is an excellent professor, and a very nice person! He used powerpoints, which was a huge improvement over 163A. Make sure he continues to use these as a tool; it just might make or break your understanding of a wonderful -but difficult- chunk of material. Does curve. I am going to go out of my way to take another class with Prof. Chen! :)

Shaowei is a very accommodating and friendly professor. However, he is extremely difficult to understand. Also, his lectures aren't very organized which exacerbates the problem. Perhaps if he used a powerpoint or gave an organized outline of each lecture this would help. His tests are hard and it's unclear what you are expected to know.

Why this class in only two units is a mystery. Several ridiculously demanding and tedious lab reports will leave you feeling frustrated at best and like crying at worst.Oh, and there is also a final exam. The topics are interesting but the work load absurd. The T.A. will make all the difference in the world to you. Good luck.

Nice enough. Difficult to understand. Simple quizes. 85% of grade based on one paper. No lab manual. No text. Lectures from power point. Since there are no other options for the course, pray you get an excellent T.A.
very helpful in office hours and after lectures;  could see his efforts to try to explain things clearly during lectures (he seemed quite conscientious about his accent).  overall, good teacher.

What did he say? Nobody knows. It's not just his accent (which is heavy); it's the fact that he is constantly mumbling. It sounds like he has a mouth full of marbles. 75% of the grade was based on a final project (which we were given about 2 weeks to do), and hardly anyone knew what was going on. Adafd asdfj aie, afj. Get that? No? I didn't either.
